business.headline: EPFO raises auto-settlement limit to Rs 5 lakh for faster fund accessIn the fiscal year 2024-25, the EPFO processed a record 2.34 crore advance claims through the auto-settlement process, marking a 161% increase compared to the previous year.
Sensex jumps 500 points: Why is stock market rising today? The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 529.55 points to 82,584.66, while the NSE Nifty50 added 151.55 points to 25,195.90 as of 10:08 am.

HDB Financial opens today: Should you subscribe to the biggest IPO of 2025?HDB Financial IPO: The public listing consists of a fresh issue of 3.38 crore shares worth Rs 2,500 crore, and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of 13.51 crore shares, totalling Rs 10,000 crore.
Sensex, Nifty rally continues for second day as geopolitical fears subsideThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 442.13 points to 82,497.24, while the NSE Nifty50 added 127.10 points to 25,171.45 as of 9:32 am.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to open higher? Check key trading levelsA fragile ceasefire between Iran and Israel has helped calm investor nerves and improve market sentiment across Asia and other major regions.

Stocks to watch on June 25: Infosys, Union Bank, RITES, Aurobindo PharmaMarkets saw a volatile session on Tuesday as they tracked the developments in the Middle East. The benchmark indices showed sharp ups and downs before closing with small gains.

Why middle-class Indians prefer Dubai to India for buying property, explains CAIn Dubai, many middle-class Indian couples have managed to purchase two to three properties by saving meticulously over the years. These properties, which offer rental yields of 6–7%, are financed at an interest rate of just 5%, creating sustainable assets that serve as both income sources and retirement plans.

Oman becomes first Gulf nation to introduce income tax from 2028The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has already hinted that other Gulf nations may eventually need to introduce income tax too, especially as global demand for fossil fuels continues to decline.

Sensex ends 158 points higher, Nifty settles above 25,000; Adani Ports down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 158.32 points to close at 82,055.11, while the NSE Nifty50 added 72.45 points to end at 25,044.35.
Stock market down 1%: Why did Sensex, Nifty fall after early gains?The S&P BSE Sensex was up 261.25 points to 82,158.04, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 96.85 points to 25,068.75 as of 2:33 pm.

Labubu mania: How a quirky doll made Pop Mart a global giantAt the heart of this success is Pop Mart's 38-year-old founder Wang Ning, now one of China's top 10 richest people. As of June 2025, he's worth $22.7 billion, all thanks to Labubu.

Adani AGM 2025: Gautam Adani denies US bribery charges, asserts group's clean recordAhead of its AGM, Adani Airports Holdings Limited (AAHL) on Tuesday confirmed securing $1 billion in project finance for Mumbai International Airport Ltd (MIAL), which operates the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA).

entertainment.headline: Cobra Kai actor Martin Kove bites co-star, apologises later: Was being playfulMartin Kove has publicly apologised for an incident where he bit his 'Cobra Kai' co-star Alicia Hannah-Kim. The actor clarified the situation to fans, ensuring no harm was intended during the Karate Kid series shoot.

Brad Pitt on alcohol addiction after Jolie split: I needed rebootingBrad Pitt recently opened up about his alcohol addiction. He shared that Alcoholics Anonymous helped him overcome it after his split from actor Angelina Jolie.

Decoding Sitaare Zameen Par's no-OTT business model: Trendsetter or one-off flex?Aamir Khan's decision to release 'Sitaare Zameen Par' exclusively in cinemas has brought fresh hope to multiplexes. While urban audiences embrace the film, smaller towns show mixed reactions, highlighting changing viewing habits across India.

Did Esha Gupta date Hardik Pandya? Actor answersActor Esha Gupta addressed reports about her rumoured relationship with cricketer Hardik Pandya. She recalled her interaction and bond with Pandya during the time reports surfaced about their alleged romance.

Priyanka Chopra joins Idris Elba, John Cena at Heads of State New York premierePriyanka Chopra looked stunning in a shimmery gown as she joined Idris Elba and John Cena at the 'Heads of State' premiere.

Sitaare Zameen Par box office Day 5: Aamir's film remains rock solid during weekdaysOn Tuesday, Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' performed as well as it did on its first Monday. The film's steady business during the weekdays establishes the audience's faith in its content.

Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce make red carpet debut, walk hand-in-hand in styleSinger Taylor Swift and Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce made their red carpet debut at a training camp. A video of the couple walking hand-in-hand has gone viral.

Mika Singh says desh pehle after calling Diljit Dosanjh fake amid Sardaar Ji 3 rowSinger and rapper Mika Singh lashed out at Diljit Dosanjh for collaborating with Pakistani actor Hania Aamir in 'Sardaar Ji 3' amid India-Pakistan conflict. He called him a 'fake singer'.

Diljit Dosanjh recalls crying over Met Gala look, sneaking kirpan to eventSinger-actor Diljit Dosanjh recently opened up about his Met Gala experience. He explained how Shakira helped him carry a 'kirpan' to the blue carpet.

Rajamouli debuts in Death Stranding 2 video game, excited fans call him global iconDirector SS Rajamouli and his son, SS Karthikeya, made cameo appearances in Hideo Kojima's Death Stranding 2: On the Beach. A clip featuring the two in the video game is going viral on social media.

Situation beyond control: Diljit Dosanjh on Sardaar Ji 3 row over Pak actorActor Diljit Dosanjh, in a recent interview, opened up about the ongoing controversy surrounding 'Sardaar Ji 3'. The actor and the makers are facing the heat over casting Pakistani actor Hania Aamir amid India-Pakistan tensions.

Diddy's team uses Cassie's 'loving' texts to counter accusationsSean "Diddy" Combs' defence rests after brief testimony in his sex trafficking trial. Closing arguments begin Thursday as jurors prepare to decide his fate; he faces up to life in prison if convicted.

Rajkummar Rao nervous to play Sourav Ganguly in biopic, says it's a huge responsibilityActor Rajkummar Rao opened up about playing Sourav Ganguly in his biopic on Tuesday. He said he is nervous about playing the role as it is a huge responsibility.

Raid 2 OTT release: When and where to watch Ajay Devgn's crime thrillerAjay Devgn and Riteish Deshmukh's hit film 'Raid 2' is set to stream on Netflix from June 26, 2025. After earning over Rs 157 crore at the box office, the crime thriller now gears up for its digital debut.

And Just Like That's Cynthia Nixon, Kristin Davis on playing flawed women'And Just Like That' cast discusses the importance of flawed women on screen. The series highlights evolving roles and authentic representation in Indian and global contexts.

Jacqueline Fernandez honoured at Italian Global Series Festival 2025Jacqueline Fernandez received a special honour at the 2025 Italian Global Series Festival in Rimini for her remarkable contribution to cinema. She shared heartfelt moments from the event on Instagram, expressing gratitude for the international recognition.

Sana Khan's mother dies after health struggle, former actor shares emotional postSana Khan's mother, Saeeda Khan, died after a prolonged illness. The former actor shared the news on Instagram, asking fans to pray for her mother's soul.

BTS' Jimin joins Killin It Girl dance challenge. Watch viral videoBTS member Jimin posted a video of him dancing to fellow member JHope's 'Killin' It Girl' song. This is the first video the singer posted after getting discharged from the military on June 12.

Sonakshi on box office clash with Kajol: Proud our film releases alongside hersSonakshi Sinha expresses pride as her film 'Nikita Roy' releases alongside Kajol's 'Maa'. She welcomes the box office clash as a positive moment for both actresses.

general news.headline: Iran hangs 3 'Israeli spies', arrests 700 others day after US-brokered ceasefireIran on Wednesday executed three men, after they were convicted of collaborating with Israel's spy agency Mossad. Also, as many as 700 people were arrested for ties with the Jewish nation. These developments come a day after the US-brokered truce deal between Israel and Iran.

Pak officer who captured Abhinandan Varthaman in 2019 killed in Taliban clashPakistani Major Moiz Abbas Shah, who was involved in the 2019 capture of Indian pilot Abhinandan Varthaman, was one of two personnel killed in a clash with Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) terrorists in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa region.

Five reasons why India slipped ship in their Headingley Test loss vs EnglandIndia's promising start under new Test captain Shubman Gill ended in a frustrating five-wicket loss at Headingley, as collapses, dropped catches, and a one-dimensional bowling attack allowed England to script a memorable chase.

Why UK's lethal F-35 jet, worth $110 million, is stranded in Kerala for 10 daysSince June 14, a $110-million British F-35B stealth jet has remained grounded at Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram airport after an emergency landing. Ten days on, with failed repair attempts, the jet remains in the monsoon-drenched tarmac. What will it take to get the F-35 to get it airborne?

The art of not giving a f*** about Donald TrumpAfter dropping the F-bomb in front of the cameras, a visibly furious Trump retired to his chopper. It was a long, dreary walk, the MAGA hat hanging loosely in his hands. As he boarded his jet to the Netherlands to attend a NATO summit, Trump left hoping the flimsy ceasefire he had brokered would hold in the days to come.

Parliament gagged, rights suspended: PM's diatribe on Emergency anniversaryOn the 50th anniversary of the Emergency, which the Centre has decided to observe as Samvidhan Hatya Diwas, PM Narendra Modi said no Indian would ever forget how the voice of Parliament was muzzled and attempts were made to control the courts.
WATCH LIVE: India's Shubhanshu Shukla to launch to space shortlyThe Ax-4 crew will board a brand-new SpaceX Crew Dragon capsule, marking its maiden voyage to the International Space Station.

US intel says Iran strikes only delayed nuke programme, Trump calls it fake newsA US intelligence report said airstrikes ordered by President Donald Trump did not fully destroy Iran's nuclear sites Fordow and Natanz, and only delayed the programme by a few months. However, Trump and the White House called out the report, labelling it as "fake news".

The fall of the iron fist: The end of Indira's EmergencyThe final part of the Democracy's Darkest Hour series charts the collapse of the Emergency, the surge in public resistance, and the lead-up to the 1977 general elections that brought India's authoritarian chapter to a close.

Meril Launches MyClip, India's First Transcatheter-Edge-to-Edge Repair (TEER) System for Treatment of Severe Mitral RegurgitationThe launch of MyClip TEER System marks a transformative moment for structural heart therapy in India.

Who is 'Big Balls'? Teen DOGE engineer quits US governmentEdward Coristine, also known as "Big Balls," is a 19-year-old technologist who recently resigned from the US government's Department of Government Efficiency after a brief and controversial stint in the US government.

Zohran Mamdani, 33, wins Democratic mayoral primary after Andrew Cuomo concedesIndian-origin Zohran Mamdani, 33, has won the Democratic mayoral primary after rival and former Governor Andrew Cuomo conceded. Mamdani is the son of famous Indian-American filmmaker Mira Nair.

Situation beyond control: Diljit Dosanjh on Sardaar Ji 3 row over Pak actorActor Diljit Dosanjh, in a recent interview, opened up about the ongoing controversy surrounding 'Sardaar Ji 3'. The actor and the makers are facing the heat over casting Pakistani actor Hania Aamir amid India-Pakistan tensions.

Woman sent flying in air as mini truck veers left, rams and kills herA woman died in Hyderabad after being struck by a speeding mini-truck when she stepped out of her broken-down car. The driver fled the scene immediately.

What is the Dragon spacecraft that Indian astronaut will pilot to space?Shubhanshu Shukla will pilot SpaceX's Dragon spacecraft as part of the Axiom-4 Mission as it lifts off atop the Falcon-9 rocket from the Kennedy Space Centre.

Norwegian man claims he was denied US entry over meme of bald JD VanceA 21-year-old tourist from Norway was barred from entering the US after immigration officials at Newark Airport found a meme of Vice President JD Vance on his phone. Mads Mikkelsen says he was deported the same day despite having no criminal record.

Decoding Sitaare Zameen Par's no-OTT business model: Trendsetter or one-off flex?Aamir Khan's decision to release 'Sitaare Zameen Par' exclusively in cinemas has brought fresh hope to multiplexes. While urban audiences embrace the film, smaller towns show mixed reactions, highlighting changing viewing habits across India.

Gambhir backs pacers despite Leeds disaster: Building a battery for futureIndia's head coach Gautam Gambhir has called for patience with the young bowling attack after a heavy defeat in Leeds. He stressed the need to back inexperienced pacers to build a strong pace battery for the future.

Jhooth bole, kauwa kaate: Mahayuti hits back at Rahul Gandhi's poll scam claimMaharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, along with Deputy Chief Ministers Eknath Shinde and Ajit Pawar has hit back at the Congress leader over his allegations of scam in the Maharashtra Assembly Elections 2024.

Shubhanshu Shukla is taking Joy along on trip to space. LiterallyIndia's Shubhanshu Shukla, part of the Axiom-4 crew, is taking along a plush toy on his trip to space. It's a toy with a mighty mission as this adorable swan is more than just a zero-gravity indicator. It's a symbol of unity, culture, and the emotional heart of the crew.

James Beard winner, Tamil pride ambassador, meet Chef Vijay KumarIn an exclusive conversation with India Today, award-winning Chef Vijay Kumar shares how he serves that taste of South India in New York and also broods over the ongoing political tensions and more.

Neeraj Chopra not happy despite winning gold in Ostrava Golden SpikeNeeraj Chopra might have won gold at the Ostrava Golden Spike, but was unhappy with his performance. Neeraj said that he needed to do better for his idol Jan Zelenzy.

Bombay High Court relies on 10-year-old witness to uphold life term in murderThe Aurangabad bench of the Bombay High Court upheld the judgement of Jalna Sessions court which had given a life sentence to a man for brutally assaulting and killing his mother-in-law.

Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce make red carpet debut, walk hand-in-hand in styleSinger Taylor Swift and Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce made their red carpet debut at a training camp. A video of the couple walking hand-in-hand has gone viral.

sports.headline: Not sure India believed they could get Leeds hero Ben Duckett out: Steve HarmisonSteve Harmison feels that India didn't believe they could get Ben Duckett after the England opener played a match-winning knock in the Leeds Test. Duckett scored 149 runs to guide England to the win.

India's tail not wagging: Familiar problem resurfacing under Gambhir eraIndia's lower order had a disappointing outing in the first Test against England at Headingley, Leeds as they failed to capitalise on the good start by the top order. Head coach Gautam Gambhir must quickly find a solution to the problem or India will continue to be outscored against England's Bazballers.

Club World Cup: Benfica stun Munich, Delap opens account in Chelsea's winBenfica caused a big upset after securing a 1-0 win over the reigning Bundesliga champions, Bayern Munich, in the FIFA Club World Cup. Meanwhile, Chelsea's latest addition, Liam Delap, scored his first goal for the club in their win over ES Tunis.

India's Jasprit Bumrah plan won't change despite Leeds Test loss: GambhirENG vs IND: Despite India's defeat at Headingley, head coach Gautam Gambhir stood firm on their decision to manage Jasprit Bumrah's workload, confirming he will play only three Tests in the five-match series against England.

India lose Leeds Test despite 5 centuries: Anderson-Tendulkar series opener in statsHere's a look at top stats from India's crushing defeat against England in the first Test of the five-match series at Headingley, Leeds. England chased down 371 on Day 5 to hammer India by five wickets.

Olympique Lyon relegated due to financial irregularitiesOlympique Lyon has been relegated from Ligue 1 following a financial audit by the DNCG. The club plans to appeal, highlighting improved finances and recent player sales.

Win together, lose together: Gambhir won't blame individuals after Leeds lossEngland vs India: Head coach Gautam Gambhir acknowledged India the batting collapses and the ordinary catching in the first Test in Leeds. However, he said he won't point fingers at anyone in this new-look Indian side.

Shubman Gill honest after losing Leeds Test: Young team will improveShubman Gill's India fell short in the Leeds Test, but the young captain's composed, honest reflections after the loss showed maturity. With errors in fielding and collapses to address, the rebuilding process has officially begun.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
